title: Vegan Double Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Chewy and chocolatey vegan cookies with a rich cocoa base.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp espresso powder (optional, but highly recommended)
1/3 cup (83 g) unsweetened applesauce, room temperature
1 cup vegan chocolate chips or chopped vegan chocolate
steps: 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2: In a bowl, whisk together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder.
3: In a separate bowl, cream the softened vegan butter with applesauce, brown sugar, granulated sugar, and vanilla until well combined.
4: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet, mixing until a dough forms.
5: Fold in the chocolate chips or chunks.
6: Scoop cookie dough onto the baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes.
7: Let cookies cool for 5 minutes on the tray before transferring to a wire rack.

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Chewy vegan chocolate chip cookies made with no eggs—just pure cookie magic.
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups (280 g) all purpose flour or gluten free 1:1 baking flour, sifted and spoon & leveled
2/3 cup (150 g) salted vegan butter, softened
1/3 cup (85 g) unsweetened applesauce, room temperature
1 cup (170 g) vegan chocolate chips (semi-sweet or your choice!)
steps: 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt.
3: In a large bowl, beat the softened vegan butter with brown sugar and granulated sugar until fluffy.
4: Add applesauce and vanilla extract to the wet mixture and stir to combine.
5: Slowly add the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until a dough forms.
6: Fold in the chocolate chips.
7: Scoop dough onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes until edges are golden.
8: Cool on the tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Muffins
description: Soft, moist muffins made without eggs or dairy.
ingredients: ½ cup mixed white & brown sugar
⅓ cup neutral oil & apple sauce
steps: 1: Preheat oven to 350°F.
2: Mix the flour and baking powder and set aside.
3: Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
4: Fold in chocolate chips.
5: Fill muffin tins to the top, sprinkle extra chips, and bake for 20 mins.

title: Vegan Funfetti Sugar Cookies
description: Chewy in the middle, crispy on the outside, fun sugar cookies!
steps: 1: Preheat oven to 350°F.
2: Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cornstarch, salt, sprinkles
3: Cream the butter, sugar, applesauce, and vanilla until smooth, no clumps.
4: Add wet ingredients and gently combine. Make sure not to over mix the batter!
5: Fold in more sprinkles
6: Roll the dough into desired balls, and bake for around 10-15 mins depending on size of cookies. Until the edges are golden brown.

title: Vegan Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies made gluten-free with oat flour and dairy-free yogurt.
ingredients: 1/2 cup (113 g) salted vegan butter, room temperature
1 cup (180 g) vegan chocolate chips or vegan milk chocolate chunks
steps: 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2: In a medium bowl, whisk together oat flour, arrowroot starch, baking powder, and baking soda.
3: In a separate bowl, cream together the softened vegan butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
4: Stir in the dairy-free yogurt and vanilla extract until combined.
5: Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients to form a dough.
6: Fold in chocolate chips or chunks.
7: Scoop dough onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes or until edges are golden.
8: Allow to cool for 5–10 minutes before serving.
